concept.title: Deleting or Modifying an Existing User

conbody.p: To delete or modify an existing Deployment Manager user:

ol.li: From the Deployment Manager Dashboard, select the Admin tab. Edit/Delete a User

To delete an existing user, browse through the current list of usernames until you find the user that want to delete. Go to the Action field and click delete.
The user is deleted and can no longer able to access Deployment Manager.
To modify an existing user, browse through the current list of usernames until you find the user that you want to modify Go to the Action field and click edit.
To change the password of a local user: retype the password; save your changes.

conbody.p: To change the password of an existing user:

ol.li: Go to the Admin tab; click edit in the row that lists the username whose password requires the change.
In the current password, enter the password of the user you are logged in as.
In the new password, enter new password for the target user.
Click the Save button when you are done.A user without Admin privileges cannot change the password for any user, including his or her own.
